snippet: Profits slightly exceeded Wall Street’s expectations, but revenue fell below, and the company’s shares were lower in after-hours trading.
abstract: IBM delivers a mixed and somewhat unsettling quarterly report with profits barely exceeding Wall Street expectations and revenue falling well below; shares, in after hours trading,  fell $7.10 a share, or 3.4 percent, to $203.90; company’s stock price rose 1 percent, or $2.07 a share, to close at $211.00 a share, in regular trading; net income was flat at $3.8 billion; revenue for the quarter fell 5 percent, to $24.7 billion, well below the Wall Street consensus of $25.4 billion.
lead_paragraph: Profits slightly exceeded Wall Street’s expectations, but revenue fell below, and the company’s shares were lower in after-hours trading.

headline.main: I.B.M. Squeezes Out a Profit as Its Revenue Declines
headline.print_headline: I.B.M. Squeezes Out a Profit as Its Revenue Declines
